page.title: 01THE ECOLOGY OF OUR AREA
page.content: THE MAIN AIMS OF OUR SURVEY WERE TO STUDY SAMPLE AREAS OF WOODLAND AND HEDGEROWS IN THE GRID SQUARES GIVEN. SECTIONS OF WOODLAND WERE FOUND IN GRID SQUARES 03730323 03740323 03720322 03730322 03740322 03720321 AND 03730321. PULESTON COMMON WAS THE FIRST AREA WE VISITED IN GRID SQUARE 03730323. THE MAP SHOWS MIXED WOODLAND BUT THE TREES WE SAW WERE ALL DECIDUOUS. THERE WERE SIGNS THAT IT WAS NOT ALL NATURAL WOODLAND AS THERE WERE A FEW OPEN SPACES WITH TREE STUMPS WHERE THE TREES HAD BEEN FELLED. THERE WERE FOUR CANOPY LAYERS. THE TALLEST LAYER CONSISTED OF OLD BEECH AND OAK TREES. AT ABOUT FOUR METRES ROWAN AND SILVER BIRCH MADE THE SECOND CANOPY LAYER. THE THIRD LAYER INCLUDED BRAMBLES AND FERNS AS WELL AS NETTLES AND TALLER GRASSES.THE GROUND LAYER
